page.title: 17DAIRY FARMING,PEMBROKE.
page.content: One of the major tasks for the dairy farmers to the south of{Pembroke}is to provide winter feed for their cows. Instead of making hay the farmer may make{silage,}for which the grass is cut while still young,juicy and full of proteins.It is not left to dry but is gathered in and pressed down hard in a container called a{silo.} The absence of air and the slight heat from the grass form an acid which preserves the{proteins}in the grass.It is these proteins which make silage a far better feeding stuff than ordinary hay,for animals need proteins to build muscle and to make milk.
